comment.author: 54352900@N04
comment._content:
It would be beneficial to the NSW RFS to place a date on the photo and ascertain the particular time of year. The smoke visible towards Taronga Park Zoo could provide planning of Hazard Reduction Burning regimes.

Mick Leon
MNC

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/54352900@N04] It's unfortunate that many of these images have lost some of the information associated with them over time. These photographs were taken by officers of the Government Printing Office during the years c.1870-c.1920. Hopefully we'll get some discussion here on Flickr that might narrow down the date for us.
-AG

comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content:
An extraordinary number of white navy ships are visible (at least 10) . Could be the visit of the 16 ships of the US 'Great White Fleet' to Sydney in 1908.  Seen here:

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/7819530218/]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/54352900@N04] Whisky Tango Foxtrot ? [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] I think you are right. Late August (winter) 1908, it that helps [http://www.flickr.com/photos/54352900@N04] with the "planning of Hazard Reduction Burning regimes". The smoke is from the ships in a southerly breeze. Synoptic chart from 27/8/1908, showing gentle winds and an anti-cyclone covering Australia - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/15023171/1312734?zoomLev...

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Well spotted beachcomber. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/54352900@N04] If you look at the original image size [Actions - View all sizes], what looks at first glance like smoke emanating from the distant headland on the other side of the harbour, is revealed to be smoke from the ships of the Great White Fleet.

comment.author: 73199923@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/54352900@N04] this blog details the GPO collection problems archivesoutside.records.nsw.gov.au/uncovering-hidden-trea... and the great work of pellethepoet :)
